column4: also, i was wondering why during my apt-get upgrade that a few packages were held back
i'm not following; when i installed totem, and xine (weren't these part of the package mamager) i removed the ubuntu desktop? what does this mean? the ubunutu desktop? link me to a doc plz
the ubuntu desktop?
i thought ubuntu installed the gnome desktop 2.8
are you telling me that ubuntu has it's own?
fully independant of gnome 2.8?
ok, it's a package, and installing other software that may conflict with this removed it?
ok.
so when i install xine, and totem...i can't get mplayer in my apt-get calls?
if you remove these functions from the distro, pwople can't learn how to use package management
remove what?
http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/RestrictedFormats
never said remove anywhere in there.
i felt that a major part of growing with your Linux box was breaking various dependencies and figuring out how to remedy the problems.
same as with any other distro. Specific question?
one sec
you need the development headers.
in packages postfixed with -dev
youre charecter seems to be very counterproductive, and detremental to ubuntu development
nothing ever will limit that flexibility. After all it's open source.
that's a gnome 1 program.
you are compiling gtk1 code. Gnome 2 uses Gtk2.
gtk1 is on it's way to being dead.
